Package NDL_JavaClassLib

Class DataTrace_ver_inwrks

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<OrdXYErrData>
          • NDL_JavaClassLib.DataTrace_ver_inwrks
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<OrdXYErrData>, java.util.Collection<OrdXYErrData>, java.util.List<OrdXYErrData>, java.util.RandomAccess
    public class DataTrace_ver_inwrks
extends java.util.ArrayList<OrdXYErrData>
    This class built around arrayList to mimic a container class with x - axis and y - axis values along with Error bars. Elements of the list are objects of the class OrdXYErrData. The class can be used to perform basic operations of binning, derivative and adjacent averaging (yet to be implemented as 01st May, 2022).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • populateData

        public boolean populateData​(java.lang.String fileName,
                            char separator,
                            char lineSeparator,
                            int nDataSegments,
                            boolean SD)
        Call this function to read the data directly from text file.The data is supposed to be in the format of x and y co-ordinates listed in a time series stored as text(ascii) file.(i.e.x1 \t y1 \n x2 \t y2\n....EOF).x1,y1 co -respond to co-ordinates at time t1, x2, y2 at time t2. tn+1 is the time sample immediately after tn of an uniformly sampled data. The above is an example for data with no error bars (nDataSegments = 2), when the error bar is present then format would be (i.e. x1 \t y1 \t xEr \t yEr \t nPts \n ...EOF). xEr, yEr are the error bars and nPts are the number points over which the mean is calculated.
        Parameters:
        fileName - is the name of text file from which to read the data.
        separator - is the data separator used in the text file to separate x,y, xerr, yerr and no of points. "\n" separates next line.
        nDataSegments - is the number of data segments present in a line
        SD - set it to true if the error bars represent standard deviation ignored if no error bars are used
        Returns:
        returns true if import of data from file is successful false otherwise.

      • populateData

        public boolean populateData​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Overloaded function of populateData() with data separator set to '\t' and line separator set to '\n' and data segment number is set to 2.
        Parameters:
        fileName - : Name of the text file with ascii data.
        Returns:
        :True when data is successfully read false when it fails

      • populateData

        public boolean populateData​(java.lang.String fileName,
                            int nDataSegments,
                            boolean SD)
        Overloaded function of populateData() with with data separator set to '\t' and line separator set to '\n'.
        Parameters:
        fileName - : Name of the text file with the ascii data.
        nDataSegments - : Number of data segments 2 for x and Y , 5 for x, y, xerr, yerr, number of points.
        SD - : True for error bar being standard deviation and false for SEM
        Returns:
        :True when data is successfully read false when it fails
